Treatment Effect Estimates

We define and discuss the most common metrics that researchers estimate when evaluating the results of a treatment. For further detail, see (cite).

Table of contents
  1. Standard Notation and Statistical Definitions
  2. Average Treatment Effect (ATE)
  3. Average Treatment Effect on Treated (ATT)
  4. Conditional Average Treatment Effect (CATE)
  5. Conditional Average Treatment Effect on Treated (CATT)

Standard Notation and Statistical Definitions

We say there are $i$ units or observations. These are the individuals being observed in the study. There are $n$ of them in total. We let $y_i$ be the outcome variable for each i. (y_i) \begin{math}y_i\end{math}

.. math:: (a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2ab + b^2

\[y_i\] \[e = mc^2\]
